result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte Devel Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED. Huber for employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Donte Devel Shannon in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue

Count 4- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 2 Years probation, to run consecutive to count 1 & count 3 in 15CF1006

15CF1010
Apply bond from all files to pay restituition of $220.44 then the file will be dismissed outright.

Conditions:
No drugs, no alcohol - do not go into any bars or liquor stores
AODA assessment
Enroll in counseling
Report to Racine Vocational Ministry Program
Restitution to be paid in the amount of $220.44
ZCI fees to be paid with the balance of restitution and court fees
Eligible for ERP & CIP
FAW
VOTE
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge on 15CF279 & count 1 in 15CF1006
Court costs are waived on all files
Do not drive unless properly licensed
Obtain HSED
Eligible for Huber
Obtain & maintain full time employment
Report to Racine County Jail on May 7th @ 8:30 am

Defendant Donte Devel Shannon in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Defendant Donte Devel Shannon in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- In 15CF279 Plea to count 1 as charged; DRI count 2. In 15CF1006 Plea to count 1 as charged, count 3 & count 4; DRI count 2 & count 5. In 15CF1010 once restitution of $220.44 is paid in full would dismiss the file out right. 
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1; DRI count 2 in 15CF279, count 1, count 3 & count4; DRI count 2 & count 5 in 15CF1006; 15CF1010 will be dismissed outright when the restitution is paid in full. Order PSI. The bond in 15CF1010 will put towards restitution.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  No contact with family of victim in 15CF1010.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
**8/03/2015  GPS monitor, house arrest, may only leave house for court, meetings with his attorney and is allowed to go to Gateway to enroll in school with his father. **
08/31/15 - BOND AMENDED - Defendant to live with father at 1220 Grand Ave., Racine. Defendant may also leave home for work at Fair Oaks Farm and school at Workforce Development - with documentation, and when with father or authorized person for appointments - with documentation. No driving. 
10/12/15 - BOND AMENDED TO REMOVE ELM/HOUSE ARREST. 

12/7/15 BOND AMENDED - Defendant to post an additional $300 by December 11, 2015 @ 5pm or Report to Racine County Jail.

Defendant Donte Devel Shannon in court with attorney Margaret Johnson for attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- If the court increases the bond amount, request he be given until Friday to post. 
BTC: Bond amended: Must post an additional $300 by Friday December 11th @ 5pm or report to Racine County Jail. $367 of the previous posted bond money to be paid to ZCI fees. Must report to ZCI after court today and another random test to be completed before 1/26 court date.
ZCI
